Specialists in the fields of educational media and educational technology and teachers in the fields of art and music education and home economics

faculties.name: Faculty of Social Work
faculties.about: The Faculty of Social Work was established in Aswan since 1995 as one of the colleges of the Aswan branch. The first batch of them graduated in 1999-2000 AD, and from that date until now it has been preparing practically and academically qualified human cadres to meet the needs of Aswan Governorate and other governorates in the field of social service, in addition to the start of the fqculty implementing programs to qualify graduates in the fields of school and development which It is intended to extend to other areas, provide educational programs in the field of graduate studies for graduates of the college and other colleges and institutes, and contribute to the development of civil society services.

faculties.name: Faculty of Physical Education
faculties.about:
The Faculty of Physical Education at Aswan University was established in 2013, and the study began in the college in the academic year 2014-2015 AD with nine practical and theoretical departments:
(Curricula and methods of teaching physical education - training and movement sciences - sports management and recreation -
Sports Health Sciences - Sports Psychology and Sociology - Field and Track competitions -
Collective games and racquet sports - debates and water sports - exercise, gymnastics and movement expression)
The college seeks to prepare and qualify distinguished athletic cadres capable of work, innovation and creativity through education
and distinguished learning, teaching, scientific research and the circulation of knowledge

about: Benha University (BU) was a branch of Zagazig University since 1976 by Presidential decree No.1142 in November, 25, 1976. It included five faculties (Agriculture in Mochtohor – Engineering in Shubra – commerce, medicine and education in Benha).The Faculty of Agriculture, founded in 1911, which is considered one of the oldest faculties of agriculture in Egypt.The ministerial decree No. 278 of the year 1981 was issued to establish the faculties of Science and Arts in Benha, as well as Veterinary Medicine in Mochtohor.The faculty of Law was established (as a branch of Zagazig Faculty of Law) in 1990). The ministerial decree No. 287 of the year 1994 was issued to join Faculty of Law with Benha Branch.The ministerial decree No. 301 of the year 1992 was issued to establish The Higher Institute of Nursing at Benha which has become Faculty of Nursing in 1996.The ministerial decree No. 329 in October, 01, 1998 was issued to join the Faculty of Specific Education with Benha Branch.The presidential decree No. 84 of the year 2005 was issued to separate Benha Branch from Zagazig University to become Benha University (BU).In March, 7, 2006, the presidential decree No. 83 was issued to join the Higher Institute of Technology with Benha University.In July, 20, 2006, the presidential decree No. 267 was issued to establish the Faculty of Computers and Information.Benha University (BU) is the 13th university in foundation among the 17 universities. There are several places for campus at Benha, Mochtohor, and Shubra. The University includes faculties of Medicine, Nursing, Science, Education, Physical education, Commerce, Arts, Law, Specific Education, Computers and Information and faculty of Wngineering in Benha, in addition to the faculties of Agriculture and Veterinary Medicine in Mochtohor and the Faculty of Engineering in Shubra. 180 acres of land in El Obour City have allocated for Benha University (BU) to meet the future expansion of the University. Benha University also includes some service units such as the General Administration of Students Care, three university cities for male students in Benha, Mochtohor, and Shubra in addition to two university cities for female students in Benha and Shubra as well as 36 centers and units that serve the university and the community.

faculties.name: Faculty of Engineering at Shoubra
faculties.about:
The foundation of the Faculty goes back to the engineering division of the Higher Technical Institute in Cairo, which was established in October 1961 and joined in 1975 to Heloun University, then to Ain Shams University in 1976, then to Zagazig University, Benha branch in the same year, then the Benha branch separates from Zagazig University in 2005 to become Faculty of Engineering at Shubra one of the colleges Banha university
The college seeks to prepare a successful and distinguished graduate through advanced engineering education in the field of construction and building that qualifies him for innovation, entrepreneurship and local and regional competition, and has the ability to conduct scientific research in the field of specialization in addition to providing distinguished community services and consultations within the framework of human and ethical values.

faculties.name: Faculty of Engineering
faculties.about: The Higher Institute of Technology was established by ministerial decision and was inaugurated by the President of the Republic in 1988 and joined Benha University by a Republican decision in 2006 and the name was modified in 2011 to become the new name of the Faculty of Engineering at Benha the Faculty of Engineering is committed to preparing engineering cadres equipped with knowledge and skills to compete in the labor market, capable of using and developing modern technology, and providing research in engineering fields to serve society and the environment.

faculties.name: Faculty of Computer and Artificial Intelligence
faculties.about: The Faculty of Computing and Artificial Intelligence was established in 2006 with the aim of preparing a distinguished graduate who is able to compete in the labor market in the fields of computers and artificial intelligence from the absence of advanced education that contributes to the enrichment of scientific research and community service.

faculties.name: Faculty of Science
faculties.about:
It was established in 1981 and the Faculty includes seven scientific departments, namely, Department of Mathematics, Department of Physics, Department of Chemistry, Department of Geology, Department of Botany, Department of Zoology, and Department of Entomology. The College of Science, Benha University, offers 22 academic programs through its seven departments. The college has applied the credit hour system since 2009. The college is committed to providing integrated academic and applied programs in various basic sciences with the aim of:
• Preparing a distinguished graduate who is able to research, innovate and compete in the labor market, taking into account the ethics and ethics of the profession.
• Conducting scientific research of high value and distinguished scientific publication locally, regionally and internationally.
• Employing human resources and applied research to provide training services and scientific advice to contribute to solving environmental problems and community development.

faculties.name: Faculty of Agriculture
faculties.about: In 1911, Mashthahr was chosen as a headquarters for a middle agricultural school, and in 1942 it turned into a branch of the Faculty of Agriculture, Cairo University, then into an agricultural secondary school in 1946, and in 1957 it was decided to establish the Moshtohor Agricultural Higher Institute affiliated with the Ministry of Higher Education - and the study was in two divisions - the General Division and the Guidance and Education Division Agricultural - and students were being trained in the third grade for a year in West Germany. In 1975 the Higher Agricultural Institute of Moshtohor was transformed into the Faculty of Agricultural Sciences in Mashtoor affiliated with Helwan University, then the Faculty was annexed to the University of Zagazig, Banha Branch in 1976, which became an independent university in 2005. The Faculty of Agriculture is committed to preparing specialists in various fields of agricultural sciences capable of self-learning and scientifically and practically qualified to compete In the labor market and conducting applied scientific research that effectively contributes to achieving the state's agricultural development plan while activating the positive interaction between the college and the community locally and regionally to serve the agricultural sector and develop the environment, in a behavioral framework that stems from the principles of transparency, integrity, equal opportunities and commitment to outstanding performance and continuous development.

faculties.name: Faculty of Applied Arts
faculties.about: Founded in 2011, the Faculty of Applied Arts - Benha University aspires to be distinguished scientifically and practically at the local and regional level. The College of Applied Arts - Benha University is committed to graduating a designer and engineer who is able to innovate and compete at the local level and provide high-quality scientific research according to the needs of the industrial community and distinct community services within the framework of ethical and human values.

faculties.name: Faculty of Commerce
faculties.about: The university started as a branch of Zagazig University in 1976, then the new name became the Faculty of Commerce, Benha University in 2005 and the Faculty of Commerce, Benha University strives to become at the forefront of the leading colleges in the commercial fields in the Middle East region in general and the Arab Republic of Egypt in particular, by adhering to the highest standards In the fields of education, research and innovation. And the Faculty of Commerce, Benha University, provides its students with the necessary education to create a generation of highly educational qualifications with a sense of social responsibility, guided by accuracy and excellence while taking into account the development of international standards in commercial fields. The college also adopts creative critical thinking that contributes to the advancement of scientific research and development for the benefit of society in general.

faculties.name: Faculty of Education
faculties.about: The College of Education in Benha was established in (1976) as one of the colleges of Zagazig University, Benha Branch, and the study began in the first division in the university administration building, then the study moved to the old College of Education building (currently Physical Education) in the year (1979) with the lease of a runway in the Muslim Youth Building in the city of Benha Then the study moved to the College Complex building in the academic year (2000) and the study continued until a special building for the college was established in the Colleges Complex in Kafr Saad and it was moved to in (2013). The College of Education aims to prepare professional teachers and support scientific research that works On developing the educational system, educational curricula and methods, and keeping students and teachers in touch with inventions and modern technology.

faculties.name: Faculty of Law
faculties.about: The study began at the faculty in 1991, the Faculty of Law at Benha University seeks to be a leading regional entity in the legal field and social participation. It is also working to prepare a graduate who is able to compete in the labor market, develop his legal skills, and prepare researchers capable of conducting legal research in a way that serves the local and regional community.

faculties.name: Faculty of Arts
faculties.about: The College of Arts in Benha seeks to achieve leadership and excellence in the fields of literature and human sciences at the local and regional levels in order to attract students who are distinguished scientifically and morally, and to be able to graduate artistic, professional and literary creative citizens, as well as to positive participation in scientific research, and to open scientific channels with other universities, and it works To activate their contributions to enriching cultural and intellectual life within the university, as well as serving society and developing the environment

faculties.name: Faculty of Medicine
faculties.about: The Faculty of Medicine in Benha is the ninth Egyptian medical faculty in terms of its date of establishment. The study began in the college in 1978 and the College of Medicine in Benha is committed to qualifying qualified doctors who are able to compete and gain scientific knowledge, and it also pledges to support scientific research while serving the development of the medical service and supporting the surrounding environment within an ethical framework.

faculties.name: Faculty of Veterinary Medicine
faculties.about: Republican Decree No. 278 was issued on 05/28/1981 to establish the College of Veterinary Medicine, Zagazig University - Benha Branch - which is located in Moshtohr, and it is a college accredited by the National Authority for Quality Assurance of Education and Accreditation since September 2013 and the college includes the subclinical departments building, the clinical departments building and the hospital building The educational veterinarian, the administration building, and the grand grandstand building

faculties.name: Faculty of Nursing
faculties.about: Faculty began with 51 students in the academic year 93 / 1994. The faculty seeks to be the leader between other nursing faculties through provide the best learning chances for students and equip them with knowledge, skills, and behaviors &values which prepare them for succeeding in world seeking for competency.

faculties.name: Faculty of Physical Therapy
faculties.about: The study began at the Faculty of Physical Therapy, Benha University, in 2020 as part of the university’s plan to establish a new group of medical colleges at the university. The College of Physiotherapy was established and equipped according to quality standards, and specializations that are compatible with the requirements of the twenty-first century and are in line with the requirements of the labor market have been established.

contact_info.contact_info: Fareed Nada Street, Benha, Qalubiya - Postal Code: 13511

about: The Cairo University Beni Suef branch was established in 1981Beni Suef University was established in 2005 by Republican Decree No. (84) and became independent from the prestigious Cairo University.The university includes (Faculty of Commerce - Faculty of Law - Faculty of Veterinary Medicine - Faculty of Arts - Faculty of Science - Faculty of Education - Faculty of Pharmacy - Faculty of Medicine - Faculty of Nursing - Faculty of Industrial Education-Faculty of Engineering-Faculty of Physical Education)The university study system consists of two semesters, except for the Faculty of Medicine, where the duration of study in each semester is 15 weeks, followed by an end-of-semester exam. The general result of the group is at the end of the academic year.The number of graduates since the start of study at Beni Suef faculties until 2007 is 62,321 graduates from various colleges and institutes.

faculties.name: Faculty of Commerce
faculties.about: The college was a branch of Cairo University since the establishment of the Faculty of Commerce in 1976 until the issuance of the independence decision and its implementation in its first academic year 2005-2006. The new faculty building was inaugurated on the university campus in 1988. The College of Commerce at Beni Suef University seeks to provide distinguished education to qualified youth, equipped with advanced knowledge, skills and experiences, in order to support their capabilities of giving, innovation and professional creativity in the labor markets, relying on scientific and administrative human cadres, and the components. Developing available resources and making good use of financial resources and maximizing them using unconventional methods.

faculties.name: Faculty of Arts
faculties.about: The faculty began in 1985 when a ministerial decision was issued to establish the Faculty of Arts at Cairo University, Beni Suef Branch. Beni Suef University became independent in the academic year 2005-2006. The College of Arts - Beni Suef University looks forward to national and international accreditation for its programs and activities in order to prepare and qualify specialized, academically and field-accredited graduates in the disciplines of arts, humanities and social sciences. The College of Arts - Beni Suef University works to provide high-quality study programs in the fields of literature, humanities and social sciences, to prepare distinguished specialists to work in productive and service institutions, in accordance with local and regional standards, and the college also seeks to provide distinguished programs for postgraduate studies and the development of scientific research, in a way that serves the community And it contributes to solving its problems and developing the environment.

faculties.name: Faculty of Education
faculties.about:
The Faculty of Education was established within the Beni Suef branch of Cairo University under Resolution No. 239 of 1983 and the study began in the Division of Basic Education in 1989-1990, then the study began in the General Division with its various specializations, and in the year 1992-1993 Ministerial Decree No. 800 of 1997 was issued to establish a division Childhood.
The College of Education in Beni Suef consists of three main departments:
1)Department of Curricula and Teaching Methods
2) Department of Psychology and Mental Health
3))Department of Pedagogy, Educational Administration and Comparative Education.
The College of Education at the University of Beni Suef seeks to prepare teachers and develop them professionally to reach them to achieve the required performance standards, and to prepare researchers who are able to contribute to building knowledge and employ it in solving educational and life problems and to provide educational services in order to achieve the development of education and the advancement of society

faculties.name: Faculty of Law
faculties.about:
Studies began at the Faculty of Law, Beni Suef University, in the academic year 81/82
  The college seeks to spread awareness and legal culture, encourage comparative legal research in light of contemporary social and economic problems and issues, and enhance knowledge of human rights and fundamental freedoms by means of presenting an integrated package of legal, legal and economic sciences. The college works to qualify and prepare specialists in the field of legal sciences to meet the needs of the labor market in all institutions. Local and international public and private

faculties.name: Faculty of Medicine
faculties.about:
Republican Decree No. 23 of 1995 was issued to establish the College of Medicine and the University Hospital attached to it.
The College of Medicine at Beni Suef University seeks to make the College of Medicine in Beni Suef a distinguished medical scientific center at the local and global level that contributes to the development of health sciences, distinguished by the quality of its graduates, the quality of its research, and the relevance of its training programs to local and global needs. The college works to play a distinguished educational, training, research and health role, providing the community with doctors of high values and ideals, competent and capable of continuous self-learning, providing quality health care, following up on specialized training, contributing to scientific research and interacting with the local medical community

faculties.name: Faculty of Veterinary Medicine
faculties.about: In 1981 the Supreme Council of Universities decided to establish the College of Veterinary Medicine in Beni Suef, and Presidential Decree No. (78) dated 1982 CE was issued including the establishment of the College of Veterinary Medicine in Beni Suef. Studies at the College began in the academic year 1982/81 by accepting the number (50) A male and female student from the governorates of Beni Suef, Fayoum and Minya. The Faculty of Medicine, Beni Suef University, is working to prepare veterinarians with scientific competence and distinguished practical skill and seeks to achieve a distinguished position in the international rankings among the corresponding colleges regionally and internationally

faculties.name: Faculty of Science
faculties.about: The faculty is located on the western campus at the entrance to the city of Beni Suef from the north. Salah Salem Street. The Faculty of Science in Beni Suef was established in 1984 and was affiliated with Cairo University as a branch in Beni Suef until the branch became a university according to Presidential Decree No. 84 of 2005. Since its establishment, it has been striving to activate its capabilities and capabilities to enrich the experiences of its students, relying on this on the scientific and intellectual experiences of its teachers. The college includes three major sectors: the education and student affairs sector, the postgraduate studies and research sector, and the community service and environmental development sector. The Faculty of Sciences of Beni Suef consists of six departments: the Department of Chemistry, the Department of Botany and Microbiology, the Department of Zoology, the Department of Physics, the Department of Geology, and the Department of Mathematics and Computer Science. The college operates the credit hour system and it is the first college to operate in this system and it is also the first college at the university level to obtain accreditation from the National Authority for Quality Assurance and Accreditation since 2015, where its graduates can compete in the local and regional labor markets

faculties.name: Faculty of Pharmacy
faculties.about: The study began at the Faculty of Pharmacy, Cairo University, Beni Suef branch, in the academic year 94/95 in the preparatory year, in the building of the Faculty of Science, Beni Suef. The college was moved in 1998/99 to a separate building consisting of 2 suites, each suite consisting of five floors. The Faculty of Pharmacy at the University of Beni Suef is one of the institutions of higher education that aspires to excellence in education and the advancement of scientific research related to the various pharmaceutical sciences and services the needs of society related to the pharmaceutical issue. The Faculty of Pharmacy at Beni Suef University seeks to become a distinguished faculty at the local and international levels in the field of education and scientific research related to the various pharmaceutical sciences

faculties.name: Faculty of Nursing
faculties.about: The Faculty of Nursing, Beni Suef University, was established in 2000. The faculty looks forward to achieving a leadership position within the corresponding faculties locally and regionally in the field of nursing education, scientific research and community service. The College of Nursing seeks to graduate qualified and distinguished nursing cadres scientifically and professionally, keeping pace with local academic standards, able to provide high quality nursing care in all health institutions, and able to compete in the labor market, as well as preparing distinguished scientific researchers to contribute effectively to solving the health problems of the community.

faculties.name: Faculty of Physical Education
faculties.about: The Faculty of Physical Education, Beni Suef University, was established in 2006. The college seeks to graduate scientifically and physically qualified athletes to become sports cadres in all disciplines in educational and sports facilities.

faculties.name: Faculty of Engineering
faculties.about:
The Faculty of Engineering in Beni Suef was established by Presidential Decree No. 267 of 2006.
The faculty began work in 2009, the Department of Civil Engineering, and then the Department of Architecture in 2012.
To graduate highly skilled specialized engineers, capable of absorbing technology
Modern technologies in engineering fields, dealing with them efficiently and keeping pace with their continuous global developments.

faculties.name: Faculty of Industrial Education
faculties.about: The Faculty was established by Ministerial Resolution No. 301 of 1992 in the name of the College of Industrial Education to graduate a new type of teachers who are able to understand and absorb modern technology and who are educationally qualified to teach industrial technical subjects. The study began in the academic year 1993/1994 and was affiliated with the Ministry of Higher Education and the President of the Republic agreed. On 7/3/2006 the college joined the University of Beni Suef. The College of Industrial Education looks forward to achieving academic excellence in industrial education and preparing a graduate who meets the global requirements of the labor market.

faculties.name: Faculty of Computers and Information
faculties.about:
The decision of the Supreme Council of Universities to approve the establishment of the College of Computers and Information Systems was issued in its session on Thursday, July 26, 2012, provided that the study begins in the school year 2012/2013.
The College of Computers and Information Systems strives to activate its potential and ability to enrich the experiences of its students, relying on the scientific and intellectual experiences of its professors. The college includes three major sectors:
The Education and Student Affairs Sector, the Graduate Studies and Research Sector, and the Community Service and Environmental Development Affairs Sector.
The Faculty of Computers and Information Systems at Beni Suef University consists of four departments:
Department of Computer Science.
Department of Information Systems.
Information Technology Department.
Multimedia section.

faculties.name: Faculty of Economics and Political Science
faculties.about: The Faculty of Economics and Political Science at Beni Suef University was established by a presidential decree in 2013; To open its doors to receive its first class in the academic year 2013/2014, where the number of students in the first batch of the college reached 560 male and female students.

faculties.name: Faculty of Postgraduate Studies for Advanced Sciences
faculties.about: Due to the rapid and successive development of modern sciences and their applications in industry, and the increasing demand for modernizing the capabilities of individuals for the advancement of industry and society inside and outside the university. In view of the overlapping of disciplines and scientific fields on each other, it has become necessary to link research with industry through advanced technological sciences. Therefore, Beni Suef University decided to establish the Faculty of Postgraduate Studies for Advanced Sciences. The College of Graduate Studies for Advanced Sciences seeks to become a distinguished scientific school in the field of conducting advanced scientific research and studies between universities and research centers locally, regionally and globally. It also contributes to solving industrial problems and achieving sustainable development. The college is committed to preparing specialized and qualified research and professional cadres to meet the work need and contribute to the study and research of industrial problems of a local, regional and global nature through applied scientific studies and research, working on the development and sustainability of resources and preparing appropriate mechanisms to measure their rates in accordance with national standards and building partnerships with various institutions concerned with research scientific

faculties.name: Faculty of Dentistry
faculties.about: In line with the policy of Beni Suef University in spreading science and knowledge, advancing progress and serving the community, the university established the Faculty of Dentistry in 2013. The Faculty of Oral and Dental Medicine, Beni Suef University is committed to providing a distinguished educational service based on the latest educational and technological methods to prepare an ethically and professionally committed dentist with high cognitive, technical and research skills capable of competing in the labor market locally, regionally and internationally. The college is also committed to its educational and therapeutic role - in line with international quality standards - in community service and works to achieve an integrated system for scientific research and innovation in the field of oral and dental medicine with high efficiency and a creative human element.

faculties.name: Faculty of Media
faculties.about: The Faculty of Media, Beni Suef University, was established by Ministerial Resolution No. 1035 of 2013, and its work began in the 2013/2014 academic year. The college is working on preparing Egyptian graduates to work in the various fields of media, capable of dealing with information and communication technology, committed to the ethics of the media profession and able to compete at the national and regional level and conduct scientific research related to the priorities of the regional community and contribute to the development of media institutions by providing consultations and training programs and preparing a generation of researchers Scholars represent the nucleus of a major research trend in Egyptian and Arab issues in the field of media and development.

faculties.name: Faculty of Physical Therapy
faculties.about: The Faculty of Physical Therapy at Beni Suef University was established by Prime Minister Decree No. (595) of 2013. The Faculty of Physical Therapy - Beni Suef University strives for leadership, local and regional summit, and recognition of excellence globally. The Faculty of Physical Therapy - Beni Suef University is committed to graduating graduates who are able to meet the needs of various levels of the local labor market at a highly competitive and distinguished level, and researchers who are able to develop the profession at a competitive research level within the framework of values and customs that support community service and continuous learning through continuous development of educational programs and research Scientific.

faculties.name: faculty of Agriculture
faculties.about: The Faculty of Environmental and Bio-Agriculture and Food Manufacturing, Beni Suef University was established by Prime Minister Decree No. 1437 of 2014. The decision of the Supreme Council of Universities was issued approving the faculty’s bylaw, which contains four basic programs: the plant production program, the animal and poultry production program, the food and dairy industries program, and the technology program. The study was started in the college in the academic year 2014/2015. The Faculty of Agriculture - Beni Suef University seeks to be an educational and research institution capable of preparing cadres familiar with the latest scientific and technological technologies in accordance with national and international academic standards in the field of agriculture and agricultural industrialization with the aim of competing locally and globally while providing distinguished community services to serve the goals of sustainable agricultural, environmental and rural development . Within the framework of the mission of Beni Suef University, the Faculty of Agriculture is committed to preparing graduate professionals and agricultural researchers in the fields of production, agricultural industrialization, land reclamation and agricultural project management, equipped with a high level of integrated knowledge and skills, capable of contributing to the development of the agricultural sector, community development, environmental preservation, keeping pace with global scientific developments and consciously Full of community problems with realistic solutions

faculties.name: Faculty of Applied Health Sciences Technology
faculties.about: The College of Applied Health Sciences Technology was established in 2014. It works to prepare skilled medical technicians at a high scientific level, capable of providing high-quality auxiliary health services with an efficiency that competes at the global level, willing to learn and continuous development. It seeks to graduate technicians who are familiar with the basics of the profession and who are able to develop them and raise their scientific level constantly and who are qualified to enter the labor market, bearing in mind the provision of high-quality service to the community as an objective.

faculties.name: Faculty of Kindergarten
faculties.about: Given the societal importance of kindergarten specialization, and the urgent need to prepare qualified teachers at the best level, and mothers who are familiar with the foundations of raising children for future generations. Beni Suef University decided to establish the Faculty of Early Childhood Education. The Faculty of Kindergarten in Beni Suef is committed to providing a qualified teacher to perform her professional, research and community roles, and to ensure the dissemination of a culture of quality in kindergartens and to support its programs in continuous training and self-financing. Quality standards and the exploitation of various modern technological means and available material and human resources.

faculties.name: Faculty of Applied Arts
faculties.about: The study began at the Faculty in the academic year 2016/2017. The Faculty of Applied Arts, Beni Suef University seeks to be a leading educational and research institution at the local and international levels in all areas of specialization and a source of creativity according to international quality standards. The college works to prepare a distinguished graduate and researcher who is able to develop his creative and technological skills, and to provide specialized technical services and consultations that meet the needs of the local and regional labor market through various educational programs.

faculties.name: Faculty of Al-Alsun
faculties.about: The Faculty of Al-Alsun was established in 2016 pursuant to Ministerial Resolution No. 1755 of 2016. The main significance behind the establishment of the College of Al-Alsun at Beni Suef University was the graduation of skilled youth in the languages spoken by peoples of geographical, cultural and civilizational weight in the world, which aids in civilized, cultural, social as well as intellectual communication . Communication through living languages is one of the most important tools of the era that aid progress and creative coexistence among peoples. Also, building an advanced society in Egypt cannot take place without effective communication with the developed countries that surround us in the European continent, as well as the promising peoples in Asia such as India, South Korea, China and Russia. As well as African languages.

faculties.name: Faculty of Social Work
faculties.about: It was established by Prime Minister Decree No. 2450 of 2015. The Faculty of Social Work, Beni Suef University seeks to prepare a distinguished social specialist scientifically, skillfully and emotionally who can compete in the labor market locally and regionally and is able to bring about positive change in society and conduct research that is concerned with studying human behavior and the social environment to develop plans The occasion for professional intervention, whether at the undergraduate or postgraduate level, and the advancement of society. It also works on developing its internal community and the surrounding local community and contributing to solving national problems.

faculties.name: Faculty of Earth Sciences
faculties.about: It was established in 2016 as an alternative to the Institute of Water and Petroleum Technology, within the framework of the university's interest in national projects that serve the country, and to contribute to the establishment of everything that contributes to the development of vital areas that serve the country. The Faculty of Earth Sciences is the first of its kind in Egypt. The faculty includes all disciplines related to Earth sciences, not just water and petroleum sciences. It deals with the study of all areas of water resource management, drainage, petroleum, mineral wealth and environmental impacts. The college seeks to be a pioneer and distinguished in the fields of exploration and management of water resources, petroleum, mineral wealth, and the environment. The college seeks to reach leadership and creativity by adopting its academic programs and specialized applications in various sectors. The college is working hard to prepare qualified scientific cadres in the fields of exploration and management of water resources, petroleum, mineral wealth and environmental impacts to meet the requirements of the labor market and provide them with practical skills that conform to the standards of the National Authority for Quality Assurance of Education and Accreditation to advance scientific research and community services.

faculties.name: Faculty of Tourism and Hotels
faculties.about: It was established in 2016. The Faculty aspires to achieve uniqueness and excellence professionally and academically to provide qualified and trained graduates according to the best scientific levels locally and regionally. It also seeks to lead in scientific research and encourage creativity and innovation in the fields of tourism and hotels. The college also seeks to contribute to the development of the tourism sector by enabling students to obtain a high level of knowledge and skills in tourism and hotel sciences, and to provide the student with a set of values that must be available to workers in the tourism industry and to provide and develop curricula, tools and methods of education, which contributes to creating a creative educational environment in accordance with The requirements of the tourism and hotel labor market.

faculties.name: The Faculty of Special Needs Science
faculties.about: The Faculty of Special Needs Science was established in 2018, thus Beni Suef University became the first university in Egypt and the Arab world to open the first College of Sciences for People with Special Needs, a college that was established to provide society with scientifically and professionally qualified human cadres using modern technologies in education to enable them to conduct high-quality research that meets the needs community for people with special needs; What qualifies them to work in the fields of special education, whether in schools, hospitals, or associations interested in people with special needs inside and outside Egypt.

faculties.name: Faculty of Navigation Sciences and Space Technology
faculties.about: The College of Navigation Sciences and Space Technology was established in accordance with Prime Minister Decision No. 849 of 2017 on 4/18/2017. The college is unique in granting undergraduate and graduate degrees in the field of navigation sciences and space technology at the regional, continental and Arab levels. The college aims to establish an integrated scientific base in the fields of navigation sciences and space technology, through advanced and distinguished study plans and programs in conformity with standard academic standards, capable of qualifying the competitive graduate in the fields of work and expansion in research fields to serve the requirements of society to reach the college for excellence and academic accreditation.

faculties.name: National Institute of Longevity Elderly Sciences
faculties.about: The institute was established by presidential decree in 2017. The Institute awards a specialized diploma in geriatric studies - a master's degree in geriatric studies - and a doctorate in geriatric studies. The Institute contributes to the development of a national strategy for integrated scientific research in the field of the elderly, which helps to prepare scientific cadres (scientific and practical) and to create models for integrated services for the elderly, which helps to promote social peace. It works on the production and innovation of information, skills, attitudes and behaviors that guarantee the right of the elderly to a more luxurious and peaceful life. Departments of the Institute: Department of Medical Care, Department of Nursing Studies, Department of Nutrition and Care, Department of Psychological Studies, Department of Social Studies, Department of Physiotherapy, Department of Technical Studies, Department of Physical Education and Recreation, Department of Occupational Therapy, Department of Engineering and Environmental Studies.

faculties.name: Laser Institute for Research and Applications
faculties.about: The aim of this institute is to create specialized and highly skilled laser personnel. The Institute is unique in the Middle East and is very different from other institutes in the region due to the great difference in objectives, objectives, and field of study. Regional and international levels in the field of post-university education and seeks to qualify specialized researchers through academic programs in the high diplomas, master’s, and doctoral degrees in order to contribute to the prosperity of society and gives the Institute Diploma of laser and master's and doctoral degrees.

faculties.name: Medicinal and Aromatic Plants Research Institute
faculties.about: Beni Suef Governorate is considered a pioneer in the cultivation of medicinal and aromatic plants due to its suitable climatic and weather conditions, in addition to the nature of the good agricultural land and its distinguished farmer with experience in cultivating these crops, as well as the governorate's proximity to export markets and major factories in Cairo Governorate. Among its leading position in this field comes the establishment of the Research Institute of Medicinal and Aromatic Plants at Beni Suef University (Prime Minister’s Decision No. 1409 of 2017) as a response to work on the completion of the Egyptian state’s national plan for the advancement of medicinal and aromatic plants and the university’s ambitious research plan 2015-2020, which seeks Through it to join the ranks of distinguished universities locally and internationally. The Medicinal and Aromatic Plants Research Institute aims to become a distinguished research institute leading in the research of medicinal and aromatic plants at the local, international and global levels, in order to keep pace with scientific progress at the world level and meet the local and external demand in maximizing and producing medicinal and aromatic plants and applications. list on it. It also looks forward to providing various services to meet the needs of the community and reach the highest level of local and international standards

faculties.name: Institute for Small and Medium Enterprises Studies
faculties.about: The Institute for Small and Medium Enterprises Studies was established by Prime Minister Decree No. 342 in 2018. The Institute seeks to achieve research and scientific excellence in all its educational and research programs and community service, and to contribute to enriching knowledge with purposeful scientific research, establishing a partnership with advanced scientific and practical societies and building a double bridge. Between him and the community in order to bring modern knowledge, technologies and research to the educational, production, service and community sectors. The Institute also seeks to provide uniqueness in the provision of academic plans and programs that have no counterpart in all institutes, colleges and universities that deal with project management and the trend towards covering the areas of small and medium project management, entrepreneurship and community partnership and achieving control over contracting works and Short-term contracts and investment risk management in small and medium-sized enterprises

contact_info.contact_info: Beni Suef Governorate - Salah Salem Street.

about: Cairo University was founded in 1908. The emergence and development of Cairo University helped the Egyptian national movement in the early twenty-first century. It produced an elite group of national leaders and pioneers of the enlightenment movement and social thought in Egypt, such as Muhammad Abdo, Mustafa Kamel, Muhammad Farid, Qassem Amin, and Saad Zagloul. The rise of the university fulfilled a dream that has troubled the imagination of the people of this country for a long time. It is the establishment of a university that advances the country in all aspects of life, and that it be a beacon of freedom of thought and the scientific basis for the renaissance of the state and a bridge to the sources of modern science, and that it is a melting pot of necessity. Qualified cadres in all disciplines to share the world in scientific progress.However, this hope found strong opposition from the British occupation authorities, especially from Lord Cromer, who realized that the establishment of the university in Egypt meant creating an educated class of Egyptians who would realize that independence is not just a liberation of the land, but a liberation of the land. It is the liberation of the Egyptian character itself. Despite the opposition, this did not dampen the enthusiasm for the idea. A committee of patriots quickly took over the matter through sacrifices and enduring difficulties until the idea appeared and became a reality.The Egyptian University was inaugurated as a private university on December 21, 1908, in a solemn ceremony held in the Shura Council Chamber in the presence of Khedive Abbas II and some statesmen. On the evening of the opening day the study began at the university in the form of lectures, and since there was no permanent headquarters dedicated to lectures at that time, the lectures were received in the various halls that were announced in the daily newspapers such as; The Shura Council of Laws Hall, the High School Club, and the Newspaper House until the university was established in the Khwaja Nestor Janaklis Saray which is now occupied by the American University.As a result of the financial difficulties experienced by the university during the First World War, the university building moved to Saray Mohamed Sedky, Al-Azhar Square, Al-Falaki Street, to save expenses. The university struggled to get back on its own two feet, and to be able to create a nucleus of its faculty by sending some outstanding students to universities in Europe, such as; Taha Hussein, Mansour Fahmy and Ahmed Deif.The university also established a library that included precious books that were donated from inside and outside the country. As a result of the great hopes that the Ahlia University achieved, which expressed the aspirations of the Egyptians, the government thought in 1917 to establish a public university, and formed a committee for that, bringing together secondary schools to the satisfaction of the university. He joined the University's Faculty of Law and Medicine on 12/03/1923.

about: Damanhour University (DU) as a scientific and economic establishment was started as branch of Alexandria University. At that time only 4 scientific institutions: Faculty of Education, Faculty of Agriculture, Faculty of Arts,  and Faculty of Commerce that shaped the distinct identity of Damanhour University (DU). Three more faculties: Science, Nursing, and  Veterinary Medicine were added according to the presidential decrees. Also, the decrees of Alexandria University Council have added new branches for Faculty of Pharmacy, Kindergarten, and Law starting from the Academic Year 2007/2008.Damanhour Branch of Alexandria University was established on the 1979/1980 academic year with Faculty of Education according to the presidential decree no. 507/1988. Then three years later, Faculty of Agriculture was established in the Academic year 1983/1984, and then became an independent faculty according to the presidential decree no. 50/1988. Faculty of Arts was started in Damanhour in 1984 as an extension for the Faculty of Arts, Alexandria University until it became an independent faculty according to the presidential decree 507/1988. Faculty of Commerce was established in Damanhour according to the presidential decree no. 507/1988. Faculty of Science and  Faculty of Veterinary Medicine were established in Damanhour according to the Presidential Decree # 87/2007. Afterwards, Faculty of Kindergarten and Faculty of Pharmacy were started in the academic year 2008/2009.  Finally, the ex-president Mohamed Hosni Mubarak has issued a Presidential Decree in 26/10/2010 stating the establishment of Damanhour University as an academic scientific identity. This decree  included 12 faculties; Arts, Commerce, Agriculture, Education, Nursing, Sciences Veterinary Medicine, Pharmacy, Kindergarten, Medicine, and Engineering.

faculties.name: Faculty of Education
faculties.about: The Faculty of Education is the oldest educational institution in the branch of Alexandria University in Damanhour. It was opened in 1979/1980 to serve the people of Beheira Governorate. Then Republican Decree No. 507 of 1988 was issued to establish a branch of Alexandria University in Damanhour, and the Faculty of Education was among the forefront of faculties in addition to the faculties of Arts, Agriculture and Commerce. The Faculty of Education in Damanhour seeks to achieve quality and obtain academic accreditation to occupy a distinguished position among the faculties of education at the national and international levels. The Faculty of Education at Damanhour University also seeks to prepare qualified teachers and cadres capable of developing educational and administrative systems in general and technical education, and researchers who are able to develop educational knowledge and employ it in solving educational and educational problems, train all educational staff and leaders and provide specialized educational services and consultations to serve the university and the community through the units with its own character

faculties.name: Faculty of Arts
faculties.about: The Faculty of Arts, Damanhour University, was initially established as a branch of Alexandria University in 1985 until the University became independent in 2010. The faculty provides a distinguished educational and research service that rises to the level of excellence and creativity in the field of arts and humanities in the labor market locally and regionally based on educational quality standards and research, and keep abreast of scientific, intellectual and technological developments.

faculties.name: faculty of Agriculture
faculties.about: The Faculty of Agriculture, Damanhour University, was established in 1984 to serve the Beheira Governorate and the neighboring cities and villages, as well as to provide services and technical consultations in various agricultural fields for agricultural companies and farmers, and to graduate technical cadres from holders of various scientific degrees in all agricultural fields and to contribute to community service and environmental development. In the Al-Abaadiya complex, the second in the School of Agriculture, and the third in the college buildings in Al-Bustan area in Delangat

faculties.name: Faculty of Commerce
faculties.about: The Faculty of Commerce was established in Damanhour as a branch of the Faculty of Commerce, Alexandria University in the academic year 1983/1984. The Faculty of Commerce at Damanhour University seeks to make the Faculty of Commerce in Damanhour one of the distinguished faculties in the field of education, training, scientific research and community service in the economic and commercial field at the local, regional and international levels, in a way that contributes to achieving comprehensive development.

faculties.name: Faculty of Science
faculties.about: The Faculty of Science in Damanhour was established in 2007 as one of the faculties of the Damanhour branch of Alexandria University. Then it became one of the main faculties on which Damanhour University was established by Republican Decree No. 303 of 2010 AD. It includes six main departments: Chemistry - Physics - Botany - Zoology - Mathematics - Geology. The Faculty of Science at Damanhour University seeks to be a distinguished educational and research institution that meets the requirements of academic standards. The college also strives to prepare and present educational programs according to standard standards in the field of basic sciences and its applications through which it can prepare trained scientific cadres capable of competing in the labor market, in addition to conducting renewed scientific research and studies using advanced technologies and communicating with local and international research bodies to meet the requirements of the advancement of society and serve it.

faculties.name: Faculty of Veterinary Medicine
faculties.about: The Faculty of Veterinary Medicine was established in 2007 and was affiliated with Alexandria University at the time. The college seeks to become a unique innovative center in veterinary education, reference laboratory diagnosis and research activities. The college has eight departments: (animal care and livestock development - biochemistry - anatomy and embryos - physiology - tissues and cells - nutrition and clinical nutrition - veterinary drugs - pathology and parasites)

faculties.name: Faculty of Education for Early Childhood
faculties.about: The Faculty of Kindergarten in Damanhour worked as a branch of the Faculty of Kindergarten at Alexandria University in the academic year 2008/2009. The Faculty of Kindergarten is considered one of the practical colleges affiliated to the Childhood Sector of the Supreme Council of Egyptian Universities, and studies in it are in Arabic or English, and the student’s attendance is required to obtain a bachelor’s degree that qualifies female students to work in Riyadh, nurseries, and special education institutions, as well as in the field of gifted care. The name of the College of Kindergarten was changed to the College of Early Childhood Education in 2019. The Faculty of Kindergarten seeks within the framework of Damanhour University's orientation to reach the model of international universities through the development and modernization of its educational programs in order to reach the application of quality standards and international academic accreditation and to keep pace with the cognitive development in the field of early childhood, similar to the distinguished international universities.

faculties.name: Faculty of Nursing
faculties.about: The Faculty of Nursing in Damanhour branch was established in 2007 to be an educational and training edifice. To complete the educational part of the training part, a temporary building was provided for the faculty inside the “National Institute in Damanhour” so that students could train within the departments of the Institute. The college seeks to provide a continuum of distinctive educational programs to prepare qualified nursing cadres for the requirements of the labor market and contribute to the development of scientific research and meet the needs of society.

faculties.name: Faculty of Pharmacy
faculties.about: The Faculty of Pharmacy was inaugurated in Damanhour, a branch of the Faculty of Pharmacy - Alexandria University in 2008. The Faculty of Pharmacy - Damanhour University looks forward to excellence in the fields of pharmacy education, scientific research, community service and environmental development at the local, regional and global levels. The college seeks to be one of the best distinguished scientific institutions in the field of pharmacy education locally and regionally. It also seeks to activate scientific research and develop effective participation and cooperation with research institutions in the local, regional and international community.

faculties.name: Faculty of Dentistry
faculties.about: The Ministry of Higher Education issued a decision to open a new faculty of dentistry at Damanhour University in 2013, to be included among other government dental faculties.

faculties.name: Faculty of Specific Education
faculties.about:
The Faculty of Specific Education was established at Damanhour University, located in the city of Nubaria in Al-Qarra. Ministerial No. 1679 of 2017. The college aims to graduate distinguished generations of teachers, technicians and qualitative innovators who are able to participate in the development and advancement of society as a scientific incubator and a house of expertise to teach, train and master handicrafts and professional activities in cooperation with professional centers
Technical workshops and factories in the surrounding environment, in addition to providing the necessary expertise to promote small projects and deepen the use of it, in a way that contributes to the development of society and provide job opportunities for its children, by preparing a graduate with scientific, technical and technological ability on technical and artistic production and conducting scientific and field research in specific fields and specializations in order to serve the labor market and achieve development and economic returns.

contact_info.contact_info: 27 Galal Koraytem Square - Behind Damanhour Stadium - Damanhour City

about: The study began in a number of faculties when the number of Mansoura University students from the sons of Damietta increased in the various faculties, then decisions were issued to establish branch faculties according to the regulations of the corresponding faculties at Mansoura University, which were developed later and added many special programs to it, so work began at the Faculty of Education in the academic year 1976-1977, followed by the College of Science and classes for the College of Commerce in the academic year 1986-1985, then the College of Specific Education in the year 90-1991, then the College of Applied Arts in the year 2004-2005, and the faculties of commerce, agriculture, literature and physical education in the academic year 2006-2007 . In 2007, Republican Decree No. (276) was issued to establish a branch of Mansoura University in Damietta.At that time, three faculties were located on one campus in the Al-Aasar neighborhood of Damietta, which are the faculties of applied arts, literature and agriculture. The rest of the five faculties are located in separate places in the new city of Damietta, which are the faculties of science, education, commerce, specific education and physical education, in addition to branch management, male housing and female housing. In July 2012, Republican Decree No. 19 of 2012 was issued to establish Damietta University, located in New Damietta.The new university website:About 200 acres have been allocated in the new city of Damietta to establish a campus for the university branch in Damietta (when it was affiliated with Mansoura University). The new university campus includes many different construction stages that serve all the activities of the university, namely:The first stage: consists of 30 classrooms and 40 classrooms, accommodating 10,000 male and female studentsThe second stage: consists of 30 auditoriums and 40 classrooms, accommodating 10,000 male and female studentsThe third stage: consists of 4 central amphitheatres, accommodating 4,000 male and female studentsFourth stage: the central laboratories and the faculties of engineering, computers and information- InfrastructureThe university's general administration building- Administrative Buildings Complex: It consists of 12 blocks, accommodating 8 collegesOlympic VillageUniversity Faculties:Damietta University includes 14 colleges:- Faculty of Education- Faculty of Science- Faculty of Commerce - Faculty of Specific Education- Faculty of Applied Arts- Faculty of Literature- Faculty of Agriculture- Faculty of Physical Education- Faculty of Engineering- Faculty of Law- Faculty of Archaeology- Faculty of Nursing- Faculty of Computing and Information- Faculty of Medicine

university_name: Egypt Japan University of Science & Technology (EJUST)
about: Established in 2009, Egypt-Japan University of Science and Technology is a non-profit public higher-education institution located in the small city of New Borg El Arab (population range of 50,000-249,999 inhabitants), Alexandria. Officially recognized by the Ministry of Higher Education of Egypt, Egypt-Japan University of Science and Technology (E-JUST) is a coeducational Egyptian higher education institution. Egypt-Japan University of Science and Technology (E-JUST) offers courses and programs leading to officially recognized higher education degrees such as bachelor degrees in several areas of study. Egypt-Japan University of Science and Technology also provides several academic and non-academic facilities and services to students including a library, as well as administrative services.

faculties.name: Master Of Business Administration (MBA)
faculties.about: The Master of Business Administration (MBA) is a unique degree option for those already established in a business or position. While maintaining a job with a company, program participants can choose this degree option to pursue an advanced education while working full-time. MBA depends on collaborative learning, immediate applicability, increased confidence and access to business school top faculty.

about: El Asher University - EAU - is an undergraduate university located in El Asher City. El Asher University was established in 2009 and was founded as a branch of Higher Technological Institute in 2009 and then became an independent University after 2011 Egyptian revolution. The El Asher University is positioned in 10th Ramadan City due to the fact it can take benefits of the city’s industrial structure and sources. This spot facilitates and permits students to carry out their teaching in the industries located there. Moustafa Zaki Zahran is the president of the university and it has about 50 professors (Academic staff) and 200 undergraduate studentsEl Asher University consist of Faculties in departments of pharmacy nursing and Engineering. The Faculty of Pharmaceutical Study gives a 5 year program of study. The academics year is separated into 3 semesters. The 1st 2 fifteen week semesters consist of academics educating. The 3rd 8 week semester is focused to functional training. On graduating, Students are authorized promptly with the Egyptian Syndicate of Pharmacy and The Faculty of Nursing gives a 4 year program of study accompanied by a one year Internship with a Health Care organization administer by the Faculty. The academics year is separated into 3 semesters. The 1st 2 fifteen week semesters give academics teaching. The 3rd 8 week semester focuses on functional training.El Asher University Library offers a huge assortment of books. The book selection is routinely updated as new material is publicized. The University library also properties an information technology section, Computer and internet services that are accessible for all students. Experienced librarians are accessible to help and aid students.

about: Founded in 2005, Fayoum University is a non-profit public higher-education institution located in the urban setting of the metropolis of Faiyum (population range of 1,000,000-5,000,000 inhabitants). Officially recognized by the Ministry of Higher Education of Egypt, Fayoum University (FYM) is a large coeducational Egyptian higher education institution. Fayoum University (FYM) offers courses and programs leading to officially recognized higher education degrees such as pre-bachelor degrees (i.e. certificates, diplomas, associate or foundation), bachelor degrees, master degrees, doctorate degrees in several areas of study. This 15 years old Egyptian higher-education institution has a selective admission policy based on entrance examinations and students' past academic record and grades. The admission rate range is 60-70% making this Egyptian higher education organization a somewhat selective institution. International students are welcome to apply for enrollment. Fayoum University  also provides several academic and non-academic facilities and services to students including a library, housing, sports facilities, study abroad and exchange programs, as well as administrative services.

about: Founded in 1975, Helwan University is a non-profit public higher-education institution located in the urban setting of the large metropolis of Cairo (population range of over 5,000,000 inhabitants). Officially recognized by the Ministry of Higher Education of Egypt, Helwan University is a very large coeducational Egyptian higher education institution. Helwan University offers courses and programs leading to officially recognized higher education degrees such as bachelor degrees in several areas of study. This 45 years old Egyptian higher-education institution has a selective admission policy based on entrance examinations and students' past academic record and grades. The admission rate range is 80-90% making this Egyptian higher education organization a least selective institution. International students are welcome to apply for enrollment. Helwan University also provides several academic and non-academic facilities and services to students including a library, housing, sports facilities, financial aids and/or scholarships, study abroad and exchange programs, as well as administrative services.

about: Kafr El-Sheikh University was established in 2006 by Republican Decree No. 129 on April 19, 2006 AD. Historically, the nucleus of the university’s faculties began at the Higher Agricultural Institute in 1957 AD in Kafr El-Sheikh, and it was affiliated with the Ministry of Higher Education, which was transformed in 1969 AD into a Faculty of Agriculture affiliated with Alexandria University, and included the faculty To the faculties of Tanta University when it was established in 1973 AD, and in 1977 the Faculty of Education was established, and in 1985 the Faculty of Veterinary Medicine was established and the study began in 1991 AD, and in 1988 the Faculty of Specific Education was established - it was affiliated with the Ministry of Higher Education and then it was transformed in 1991 by Ministerial Resolution No. 1187 to the Faculty of It is affiliated with Tanta University, and in 1992 a branch of the Faculty of Engineering was established, in 1993 a branch of the Faculty of Arts was established, and in 1997 a branch of the Faculty of Physical Education was established.      When the republican decision was issued to convert the Kafr El-Sheikh branch into a university, the branches of the faculties were transformed into colleges. All faculties of the university are located in the city of Kafr El-Sheikh, and in 2009 the Faculty of Science was established by Republican Decree No. 123 of 2009.           In 2013, the College of Pharmacy, the College of Fisheries and Fisheries Sciences, the College of Medicine, the College of Nursing, the College of Physiotherapy and the Student Hospital were established to provide the appropriate health service for the treatment of students inside the university instead of the hardship of traveling to receive treatment in Tanta. The College of Dentistry was also established in 2014.      The College of Computers and Information was established in 2015 and the College of Al-Alsun in 2016. And the Institute of Nano Science and Technology and the Institute for Drug Discovery and Development in 2017. In 2018, the College of Law and the Technical Institute of Nursing were established, and in 2019 the College of Artificial Intelligence was established, bringing the number of university faculties to 19 and three research institutes.      The university hospital with a capacity of 450 beds was also established based on the approval of the Supreme Council of Universities in its session held on 9/3/2013 and Clause No. (1) of Article 307 of the Executive Regulations of the Universities Organizing Law. The hospital was fully operational in 2016.     Also, postgraduate studies have been expanded in most colleges and institutes of the university after they were available in only two colleges, so the university made great leaps that we clearly see in the rapid development in research activities, graduate students, and the quality of academic and research programs and the university took rapid steps towards development, until it became one of the most prominent Egyptian universities distinguished themselves in education, scientific research and community service, and the distance with developed countries was narrowed through a first strategic plan that focused on restructuring the university architecturally and academically, completing its structural, human and academic components, and establishing research laboratories and centers of excellence within the university’s colleges with a high degree of technology to build a scientific base as one of the Basic priorities for development This has led to an increase in the rates of publishing scientific research for faculty members in faculties of the university in international scientific journals with impact factors.      As for the second strategic plan, it focused on excellence in education and scientific research and attention to future sciences such as nanoscience, nanotechnology and artificial intelligence to keep pace with the successive research and scientific changes in the world in accordance with policies related to the needs of society, in addition to paying attention to aesthetic values within the university and establishing many facilities supporting the educational process. In addition to many infrastructure projects such as drainage, water, electricity, sidewalks, green areas and waiting benches, in addition to the maintenance, development and improvement of all the old university facilities such as buildings, laboratories, stadiums and university cities, while providing all the necessary requirements for the development of human cadres and programs, with the expansion of postgraduate studies and in various disciplines to reach the hand of Developing everything to raise the efficiency of the performance of the university’s institutions in a way that guarantees a global competitive ability that qualifies for accreditation and to gain the trust of the community.     Despite the university's short lifespan, it was able, with God's help and grace, to take a steady step towards globalization and create a distinctive identity for it, after providing the necessary elements for success. This distinction has led to the recognition of the university’s excellence by institutions and bodies whose evaluation is considered, and the university won the title of the best Egyptian university in President Sisi’s competition for the year 2018. The university occupied a distinguished place in the international classifications, including the 601st place in the world in the British Times classification and No. 1 at the local level. The university also achieved the 151st place in the Shanghai classification in veterinary medicine specialties, and the university also achieved the second place locally and Africa at the level of Egyptian universities and the fourth in the Arab world, and 137th globally in the international rankings of “green universities that are environmentally friendly” for the year 2018. In 2019, the university achieved progress in the British Times classification of universities with an economic and social impact on society, so it jumped to the 101-200 position at the level of Egyptian universities and the first place at the level of Egyptian universities.

about: Mansoura University was founded in 1972.The study began at the Faculty of Medicine in 1962 as a branch of Cairo University, then East Delta University was established by Law No. 49 of 1972 and the name was modified to Mansoura University in 1973. It includes: Faculties of medicine - dentistry - pharmacy - engineering - agriculture - commerce - law - science - education - specific education - arts - computers and information - nursing - veterinary medicine - physical education - early childhood education - tourism and hotels - fine arts and some service units such as public administration To take care of students with their playgrounds and facilities, university cities and others for female students and most units of a special nature that serve the university and the community, in addition to the spaces occupied by university faculties located outside the university’s scope, such as the Kindergarten College located on Ahmed Maher Street and the Faculty of Specific Education in Mansoura and its two branches in the cities of Mit Ghamr and Minya Al-Nasr and the Faculty of Tourism and hotels. There is a huge student services complex on campus for students, a social club, a cultural library, a modern kitchen for university staff and faculty, as well as a modern student hospital.

about: Established in 1957, Military Technical College is considered one of the distinguished scientific research centers of the Armed Forces. Military Technical College is specialized in the fields of military sciences and technology. As a reference in the military technical applications, Military Technical College is in charge of: Graduation of Military Technical College engineering officers of scientific, practical and organizational capabilities to undertake the technical and engineering missions. Qualification of distinguished officers to conduct scientific research innovation in diverse engineering and technological fields so as to help the Armed Forces modernize the armament systems and support critical and advanced technologies. Directing the scientific and technical post graduate studies in compliance with the needs of the Armed Forces. Awarding the Diploma, M.Sc., and Ph.D. degrees in the engineering and scientific fields. Qualification and preparation of officers to work as staff members. Conducting academic and applied researches in relation to fields of studies and researches in accordance with the general strategies of the Armed Forces technical researches. Conducting new studies that fulfill the needs of Armed Forces. Proposing new engineering and technological solutions that promote the capabilities of the military equipment and improve their tactical and technical utilization. Preparation of qualified officers who can offer technical consultations to Armed Forces authorities. Cooperation with other departments to plan and develop the technical and engineering education to ensure the best quality of the scientific and technical information meeting the current and future needs of the Armed Forces. Evaluation of the scientific degrees and equivalent studies in engineering sciences from foreign universities in cooperation with the ministry of higher education and recommendation for scientific titles. To achieve self-sustainment of the Armed Forces in the fields of technology and engineering by providing engineering officers and researchers who can build and maintain armament systems and fulfill the needs of the Army operations. Military Technical College aims to become one of the best international competing institutions in the fields of research, education and knowledge. Moral principles should consider the belief in God and the full faith to the nation. A major principle is the profound trust in the capabilities of the Egyptian people, their willingness to sacrifice for the sake of distinction, dignity and independence of their beloved country.

about: New Valley University is an Egyptian public university established in 2018 independent of Assiut University and is located in the Kharga Oasis in the New Valley Governorate.On September 3, 2019, the Prime Minister issued a decision to amend some provisions of the executive regulations of the Universities Organizing Law by establishing the New Valley University, in addition to the universities stipulated in Article (2) of the Universities Organizing Law. The Prime Minister’s decision included the establishment of the New Valley University, located in the New Valley Governorate, provided that the Assiut University branch in the New Valley would be abolished, and its affiliated colleges would be included in the New Valley University.On January 31, 2020, the Ministry of Higher Education approved the project to establish a Faculty of Medicine at New Valley University, where the old governorate office building on Jamal Abdel Nasser Street in Kharga City will be converted to the Faculty of Medicine at New Valley University.On October 6, 2020, the new governor of Al-Wadi inspected the construction at the university’s headquarters north of Kharga city, where the works that are currently taking place include the construction of the buildings of the Faculty of Science at a total cost of 71 million pounds, and the building of the Faculty of Agriculture, which is built on an area of 5,800 square meters, and consists of 3 floors at a cost of 91 million The measurement and evaluation building is built on an area of 3000 square meters, and consists of three floors and includes an auditorium with a capacity of 300 students, examination halls, an equipped conference room, and administrative and service rooms.On June 10, 2021, New Valley University received the Pharmaceutical Sciences Sector Committee of the Supreme Council of Universities, to inspect the building of the Faculty of Pharmacy to be established at New Valley University.

about: Port Said University starred with the decision of the president of the Republic on 24/2/2010 to transfer Suez Canal branch in Port Said to an independent university. The history of the university extends before the decision of its establishment; as the existence of its first faculties was the faculty of engineering in 1975 under the supervision of Helwan University, then under the supervision of Suez Canal University when it was established in 1976. After that, more faculties were established in Port Said Governorate increasing to four faculties prompting the decision of establishing Port Said University as a branch of the Suez Canal University in 1998. The wise decision of the Republic President, for establishing Port Said University in 2010, was the result of the continuous increase of the faculties outreaching nine Educational institutions. Now, Port Said University consists of thirteen faculties including: faculty of Engineering; faculty of Medicine; faculty of Pharmacy; faculty of Science; faculty of Commerce; faculty of Education; faculty of Physical Education; faculty of Specific Education; faculty of nursing; Faculty of education for early childhood; faculty of Arts;  faculty of Law and faculty of Management Technology And Information Systems.
