about: The history of the Sadat Academy dates back to 1954 when the Institute of Public Administration was established on the recommendation of the English expert "Snicker" who was invited by the Egyptian government to study how to advance the Egyptian civil administration. He recommended the establishment of the Institute of Public Administration to take charge of preparing, training and honing the skills of government employees.In 1961 the companies (business organizations) operating in Egypt were nationalized and infringed, which necessitated the use of Egyptian cadres to manage them, which necessitated the establishment of the National Institute for Higher Management to prepare and train the cadres and levels of senior management in these companies and public institutions.In 1967 the Institute of Local Administration was established to train leaders And local government cadres, and from here it became three government institutes in Egypt, each in charge of administrative development activity, in 1970 it was necessary - and from the experience - to achieve integration, homogeneity and effectiveness in providing training service, merging the three institutes into one training institution, the National Institute for Administrative Development To become the first institution of its kind in the Arab world, which has become responsible for the areas of administrative development in the Arab Republic of Egypt, and to extend its activities to the entire Arab region.The experience showed the extent of the close association of the educational process with the training activity necessary to create and develop the administrative cadres, which necessitated the necessity of adding the distinguished educational educational activity as the basis for a specialized training activity, which necessitated the development of the institute, and then the Sadat Academy for Administrative Sciences was established.Which was established in March 1981 by Republican Decree No. 172 of 1981 as an independent scientific body aimed at developing management in all fields at the national level …., which focuses on the areas of training, education, consulting, research, and information, then Republican Decision No. (30) was issued For the year 2004 regarding the reorganization of the Academy.The Academy consists of: Faculty of Administrative Sciences (Cairo / Port Said / Mansoura / Alexandria), which awards bachelors degrees in management sciences, diplomas, master's and doctoral degrees.

about: Suez University was set up as a government university after a presidential decree was issued in 2012, but prior to that had been a branch of the Suez Canal University since 2006.It was the first university to be established by presidential decree after the January 25th uprising in Egypt in 2011. It began with six faculties and now has 12, which comprise the faculty of petroleum and mining engineering; the faculty of education; the faculty of industrial education; the faculty of commerce; the faculty of science; the faculty of fish resources; the faculty of arts; the faculty of economics and political sciences; the faculty of computer and information science; the faculty of media and mass communication; the faculty of medicine and the faculty of engineering.There are plans to add a faculty of pharmacy, a faculty of dentistry, a faculty of physical therapy and a Technical Institute of Nursing, as well as a university hospital. The University of Suez has about 12,350 students.The university has opened classes for the College of Education in Tur Sinai as a nucleus of new colleges that will pave the way to the establishment of the branch in Tur City, South Sinai. This forms part of its national commitment and responsibility to reconstruct Sinai.Suez, which is Al-Suways in Arabic, is a port at the head of the Gulf of Suez and at the southern exit of the Suez Canal in Northern Egypt. A naval and trade center, Suez is 130km from Cairo, with the capital accessible by both train and road. It is known for its petroleum refineries, canal workshops and an artificial fertilizer plan. It’s also a well-known departure point for the hajj, the annual Islamic pilgrimage to Mecca.

about: Founded in 2006, Sohag university is a non-profit public higher-education institution located in the urban setting of the small city of Nasser City (population range of 50,000-249,999 inhabitants), Sohag. Officially recognized by the Ministry of Higher Education of Egypt, Sohag university (SO) is a very large coeducational Egyptian higher education institution. Sohag university (SO) offers courses and programs leading to officially recognized higher education degrees such as bachelor degrees, master degrees, doctorate degrees in several areas of study. This 14 years old Egyptian higher-education institution has a selective admission policy based on entrance examinations and students' past academic record and grades. The admission rate range is 60-70% making this Egyptian higher education organization a somewhat selective institution. International students are welcome to apply for enrollment. SO also provides several academic and non-academic facilities and services to students including a library, housing, sports facilities, financial aids and/or scholarships, study abroad and exchange programs, online courses and distance learning opportunities, as well as administrative services.

faculties.about: The Faculty of Law - Zagazig University aspires, in the coming years, to become one of the most important and best faculties of law teaching and research, in Africa and the Middle East, and to obtain academic accreditation.

faculties.name: Faculty of Specific Education
faculties.about: The college aspires to become a distinguished, qualitative academic educational institution that occupies a leading position so that it will be the first house of expertise in qualitative and educational disciplines and scientific research locally and regionally.

faculties.name: Faculty of Computing and Information
faculties.about: The college aspires to the rapid and successive development in the field of science and technology and the consequent development in universities and higher education systems, in addition to the objectives of establishing the university are the foundations for setting the future vision of the college during the coming period.

faculties.name: College of Early Childhood Education
faculties.about: The state, with all its organs, seeks to take care of the early childhood stage, which is the most important stage of a child’s life, to form his legal personality and develop it in all technical, musical and sports fields, in addition to his specialized academic study in the three departments of the college (educational sciences - psychological sciences - basic sciences) in order to advance the college and university under the presidency of His Excellency Prof. Dr. Othman Shaalan, President of the University and Gentlemen of Representatives, let us stand side by side in order to raise the name of Egypt higher

faculties.name: Faculty of Disabilities and Rehabilitation Sciences
faculties.about: The College of Disability Sciences and Rehabilitation is a distinguished academic educational institution at the national level that accords with the global interest in people with disabilities, and works to promote educational knowledge and its applications in the field of disability and rehabilitation for individuals with disabilities, and emphasizes openness to the world and interaction with its similar educational and research institutions, and provides the community with human cadres. Qualified scientifically and practically, capable of using modern technologies and information technology as distinguished teachers, specialists or researchers in schools, hospitals, institutions and associations concerned with people with disabilities, and to provide high-quality services that meet the needs of individuals with disabilities, qualify them to engage in society, and to successfully perform their role in Fields and institutions of special education inside and outside Egypt in a way that contributes to achieving a comprehensive societal human development for the Egyptian society in communication with the Arab and foreign world.

faculties.name: Faculty of Archaeology
faculties.about: The Faculty of Archeology aspires for the Faculty of Archeology at Zagazig University to be one of the distinguished faculties of archeology at the local and regional levels in the study, treatment and maintenance of archeology in a way that contributes to community service and environmental development.

faculties.name: Technical Institute of Nursing in Zagazig
faculties.about: The Technical Institute of Nursing - Zagazig University aspires to be a leader in technical education for nursing and its specializations at the local and national levels and to keep pace with the ever-changing health care needs in society in line with local and international academic standards

faculties.name: Technical Institute of Nursing in Faqous
faculties.about: The Technical Institute of Nursing in Faqous aspires to be the leader in technical education for nursing and its specializations at the local and national levels, and to keep pace with the ever-changing health care needs in the community in line with local and international academic standards.

faculties.name: Higher Institute of Ancient Near Eastern Civilizations
faculties.about: The Institute aspires to become an accredited and recognized institute of excellence in education and scientific research in ancient Near Eastern civilizations and sustainable community development.

faculties.name: Institute of Asian Research and Studies
faculties.about: The Institute aspires to be a distinguished institute at the local and international levels in the fields of graduate studies and research related to the countries of the Asian continent, and a home for expertise and advice for Asian studies in various political, economic, legal, historical, leadership, religious, social, and natural resources fields, and to be a specialized center for the study of Asian languages, and the preparation of expertise Specialized operation in various Asian affairs
